name: Harmony Hotel Jerusalem - an Atlas Boutique Hotel

reviews.text: This was our first trip to Israel and Jerusalem was out first stop. After hitting the ground running upon arrival with our wonderful tour guide (Dina Horn), we checked into the Harmony. It was just perfect! Clean, and comfortable with charming and helpful staff.
reviews.title: So glad we picked this hotel

reviews.text: We loved relaxing at the outdoor happy hour, sipping wine and chatting with other guests. The 2nd day when we returned from touring (a Friday night), my daughter appeared to be coming down with pink eye. The young lady at the front desk, made several attempts to find an open pharmacy (during shabbat), but also shared with us her mom's remedy (camomile tea bags!). We went with mom's remedy and it worked like a charm!
reviews.title: Fabulous service hotel- makes everyone feel welcome!

reviews.text: Breakfast was outstanding. The best we had during our trip.
reviews.title: Great--For the most part.

reviews.text: We only stayed 3 nights, but if ever we return to Jerusalem (and we'd love to), we would not stay anywhere else.
reviews.title: Excellent friendly service great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We can not say enough good things about this gem of a hotel in a perfect location.
reviews.title: Perfect position, fantastic facilities and lovely ladies

reviews.text: This was my second visit to Jerusalem, and the second time - at the Harmony. Can't say what I liked most: tiny but clean and contemporary designed rooms, quiet hallways, reach breakfast, friendly, knowledgeable and helpful Esty at the Reception, free Internet in the Lobby, or Happy Hour, when wine, juice, tee, and snacks were served with the politeness and attention to everyone by Sergey..... Come and enjoy the "home far away from home".
reviews.title: Second time-still perfect

reviews.text: We arrived in Jerusalem and our original lodging plans were unacceptable-we found the Harmony Hotel on the web, made a reservation, and we were delighted! The staff were just wonderful, the room was clean and well-appointed, and they serve a great buffet breakfast! And..it is centrally located, near all of the sights in the Old City. We would recommend this hotel to anyone who wants to experience genuine Israeli hospitality.
reviews.title: What a great find!

reviews.text: The Harmony Hotel was an easy walk to Jaffa Gate for the Old City. Also easy access to shopping. We had extensive breakfasts in open pleasant surroundings. The rooms were clean and pleasant as well. Staff was helpful and friendly.
reviews.title: Great location to visit Jerusalem!

reviews.text: We just came back from a trip to Israel. We began by staying at the Harmony Hotel, which we understood to be a boutique hotel. Some self-described boutique hotels are nothing more than small, older hotels with a fresh badge on the front. Harmony is a new hotel built from the ground up to be exactly what it claims to be. First, we arrived at 3:00 am but the desk manager greeted us warmly and offered to help us in any way possible. The room was very clean and comfortable, perfect after 17 hours of travel.
reviews.title: Exactly what a boutique hotel should be

reviews.text: The breakfast the next morning (included in the price of the room) was the best I've ever had a hotel. There were cereals, cheeses, vegetables, eggs, oatmeal, homemade granola, fresh fruits and drinks. I just wanted to stay there and eat all day.
reviews.title: Loved it!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After reading all of the terrific reviews posted on TripAdvisor.com, I am afraid that my wife and I were expecting too much from this hotel. Unfortunately, the Harmony Hotel did not live up to its previous reviews. The rooms are very small, and the buffet breakfast somewhat limited (like a Holiday Inn Express!). The front desk staff were helpful but were not very friendly or receptive to our questions or requests.
reviews.title: Disappointment

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: For the money, you can do much better at comparable hotels in Jerusalem. We have stayed at many "boutique" hotels all over the world, and the Harmony Hotel does not qualify for this standard. Also, some of the restaurant recommendations that we got from the front desk staff were not very good, so skip this hotel if you can.
reviews.title: A convenient and comfortable home in Jerusalem

reviews.text: The Harmony was welcoming and comfortable. The hotel manager, Ayala Dekel, is experienced and accommodating, arranging my booking for a quiet room with king bed when I contacted her to let her know that my husband and I were arriving directly from the airport and would need an uninterrupted night's sleep since we were only spending 3 nights total in Israel on this trip. Our mission was accomplished; we left Jerusalem the next day after a good night's rest, a delicious breakfast served in the attractively appointed and also comfortable lobby lounge, and after visiting both the Old City (at night) and Machane Yehudah, both nicely accomplished by walking, since the hotel is so conveniently located. We even had time for shopping at the attractive ceramics coop shop directly across the street. I highly recommend staying at the Jerusalem Harmony.
reviews.title: Well deserved ranking

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I won't repeat what I've said before; this is definitely "the" place to stay in Jerusalem, for its location, for the facility and most importantly, for the staff. The Manager Ayala is a real pro and makes sure that every guest feels at home. For other comments, please see my previous reviews, because nothing has changed. The #1 ranking is well deserved.
reviews.title: Just what I was hoping for

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great location, wonderful service. We were allocated a bigger room as we were staying for 3 nights and they thought we would be more comfortable. The room was extremely spacious with a fresh rose in the bathroom. Our rental car did get damaged in the car park, so be carefull where you park ( we couldn't find a proper bay so had to park on a tight corner). Happy hour is a lovely touch as is the well kept roof terrace. Yasmin and her colleague ( A really nice chap whose name I didn't catch) were professional and warm. Loved it.
reviews.title: What a find!

reviews.text: The rooms are impeccably clean, the hotel lobby, lounge and breakfast area are clean, modern , comfortable and most welcoming. The breakfast and afternoon "happy hour" are very nice. The staff are pleasant, respectful and responsive. The location is absolutely perfect for downtown Jerusalem!
reviews.title: Excellent hotel experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent two days in this hotel. It is clean and and very nice and relatively new. The staff is professional and courteous. Excellent location. Walking distance from the Old City, King David Hotel surroundings, Mamila boutiques and shopping. My wife and myself strongly recommend this hotel. Isaac Cohen.
reviews.title: Harmony Hotel - Jerusalem

reviews.text: We stayed at the hotel in order to hold a seminar for group included members of the Israeli society and physicians from several European countries.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel, very good place to stay.

reviews.text: Hospitality was outstanding, the staff was wonderful helpful and was attentive to all our requests. The rooms were very neat and clean, including a reception honoring in each room. The conference room was tidy, quiet and convenient to discussions including tasty refreshments. The breakfast is very good same as evening happy hour which found as good time for refreshment. The wonderful location of the hotel near shops, restaurants, Mamilla Mall, old city Jaffa Gate, etc , allowed us to tour the old city without using cars or any public transportation. It was perfect for what we needed. We already set our next meeting with in the hotel.
reviews.title: Clean, friendly, good value. Loved this small hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Location is great- right in the centre of Jerusalem with easy access to cafes, shops, Old City etc. Staff were very helpful with arrangements of tours, transportation or general advice. Happy hour at the end of the day in the lounge was fantastic as it brought together many travelers who shared experiences. Breakfasts were plentiful with a variety of choices. A breakfast box was given to me on one day as I had to leave on a tour at 6am. Room was clean, neat, & comfortable..quiet location. Free wifi & TV. A great choice.
reviews.title: Good Place to Stay

reviews.text: The Harmony Hotel is part of the same group as the Art Plus Hotel in TLV, which was also very good, but the Harmony was nicer. The room (and the hotel in general) had more colour and was a bit livelier than the Art Plus (thought this could also be attributed to the fact that I was there in off season. I imagine this would be different in the spring/summer). Location wise it was great, very central. The front desk staff were very helpful, and though the room was small, it was well appointed and comfortable.
reviews.title: great hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed from 27th to 31st May at Harmony, which we had selected based on the reviews. The hotel lived up to the promise. The rooms and bath were not large but adequate, and the cleanliness was top class. The breakfast spread is good and the evening happy hour (actually 2 hours) is a relief after a hot day's outing. It's located in a small street which is not noisy and at the same time there are several restaurants next door practically and lively streets within a few minutes walking distance. The old city is easily accessible - around 15 minutes on foot. The free high speed wireless internet is excellent and one can use the house internet near the reception as well.
reviews.title: Cosy place with great staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff is absolutely marvellous. They are always courteous and smiling and helped us to efficiently plan our activities. In short a great place to stay and you need not look further if rooms are available!
reviews.title: small room but great staff!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed at the Harmony for a total of 3 nights this past May.We had a standard room for 2 nights and a superior room for 1 night. I am quite a critical person so I will rate the below criteria from 1-5 (5 being excellent).
reviews.title: Fantastic Trip, made even better by Harmony

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Location: 5.0
reviews.title: A Wonderful Place & Location

reviews.text: Hotel is within walking distance to Mamilla Mall, Ben Yehuda St, and Jaffa gate to the Old City. Could not get a better location. I guess size is all relative, we found our room to be laid out well. It had a decent size bedroom, a small hallway and a narrow bathroom. We had 3 suitcases with us, and I did not find them to be in our way. Lilach and Carmel at the front desk were always so helpful. The hotel is confusing to get to for those not familiar with the area. The hotel had plenty of free parkings spaces indoors, but what an adventure that was! I never used a car elevator in such small quarters. Upon check out, Carmel called someone to help me navigate my way out of the garage. Both my boys said how comfortable the beds and pillows were,
reviews.title: Great Hotel, excellent location!

reviews.text: Although not luxurious by American standards, this hotel has a lot going for it: friendly staff who speak perfect English, great location in an area with cool restaurants, bars, and shops, about a mile walk to the Jaffa Gate, lovely happy hour that enables you to meet other guests. Good value for the money. I would not hesitate to stay here again.
reviews.title: Charming boutique hotel.

reviews.text: We found this hotel on TripAdvisor and it's the best we have experienced on many visits to this city. Small, friendly, modern, clean, brilliantly located in the old city area, the Harmony is a small boutique hotel that we couldn't fault. Front desk people have excellent English, and the service is friendly and personal. The Harmony will be our home away from home in this city.
reviews.title: Best we have experienced on many trips to Jerusalem

reviews.text: Retired travel writer.
reviews.title: It is perfect: location, rooms, food and staff.

reviews.text: It is perfectly located for visiting much of Jerusalem; old city and new. The front desk staff is welcoming and knowledgable. There is a lovely afternoon wine and cheese for everyone, in a great room that overlooks Jerusalem and shops. The bed was great, slept like a baby. The breakfast, like all Israeli hotel breakfasts was wonderful. It is a charming boutique hotel and this was our third visit there and we will definitely come again.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel whith a great service and personal attitude

reviews.text: This was my second time to Jerusalem in two years. Last year, I did more of the touristy stuff - this year I wanted to do other things and also enjoy some of the outstanding dining experiences now available in the city. I had an absolute ton of questions from where to eat , where to go how to get there and everything else. I was, as they say in the old country, a real nudge. But the staff at Harmony is outstanding. The hotel manager, whom I had corresponded with prior to arriving, was very accomodating. Yas, the Front Desk Manager, is helpful and fun. I really felt that the staff were friends as opposed to people just doing their jobs.
reviews.title: Unbelievably Helpful Staff

reviews.text: The hotel is nice and very comfotable and the location is great - an easy 10 minute walk to the old city and 5 minutes to the major shoppiing on Ben Yehuda. Jaffe Street, which takes yoiu everywehre, is a two minute walk. Rooms are small, which is fairly prevalent in Jerusalem. The only disappointment avout the whol package is that theHappy Hour at the end of the day was not overly impressive - witht he only hot food being chestnuts and the only beverage choices being water or wine.
reviews.title: Our Home in Jerusalem

reviews.text: I would definitely stay at Harmony again next time I am in Jerusalem.
reviews.title: Highly recommended with only one or two small reservations

reviews.text: We come to Jerusalem every year to visit our daughter and we wouldn't think of staying anywhere but the Harmony Hotel. The staff is wonderful, the rooms are clean with comfortable beds, free wifi, delicious breakfast with many choices, happy hour with wine and snacks every evening. The location is very convenient to shopping and restaurants and the hotel has free underground parking with a cool car elevator. The Harmony is clearly well managed, as each year we see many of the same excellent, helpful staff and each year we have the same, extremely pleasant and comfortable stay.
reviews.title: Highly Recommended

reviews.text: This is indeed a cute hotel--above the ground floor. On the ground floor it is mostly vacant shops and the location is in an alleyway frequented by drunks. There are several levels of parking garage in the basement; we appreciated the free parking but did not like the difficulty in getting in and out of the parking garage (tight space, requires buzzing in and waiting for an attendant to use the car lift).
reviews.title: Cute Hotel in a Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed here for a night on a quick trip to Jerusalem and it was a perfect choice. Great experience and value, excellent location, awesome breakfast and lounge hour. It was perfect for what we needed.
reviews.title: The reviews are accurate

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Location.... Awesome! Close to the Old city but also to Mahane Yehuda and cafes etc. We were able to run back to the hotel to use the bathroom/wifi as we were partying all night. It's on a very quiet block though, so you can still sleep when you need to.
reviews.title: We LOVED this hotel and plan to come back.
"The Harmony is Home"
reviews.text: Staff- extremely cool and had great advice, helped with dinner reservations (especially since we arrived Friday night), etc.

reviews.title: Nice hotel, but you can't unpack!
reviews.text: Breakfast- delicious! There's a huge buffet of classic breakfast items but also salads, savory pastries and bread if that's your preferred breakfast.
We can't wait to come back! We'll never stay anywhere else in Jerusalem again. This place is really a breath of fresh air after the king david, citadel, leonardo etc. If you know what I mean...
reviews.title: Perfectly situated for exploring Jerusalem

description: Harmony Hotel Jerusalem is located in the heart of Jerusalem at Nahalat Sheva, which is one of the first neighborhoods that was built out of the old city’s walls at the end of the 19th century. This Jerusalem Hotel is Atlas’ latest boutique hotel. Twenty five years ago Nahalat Sheva was the subject to a complete restoration by the city’s municipality and today it is full of shops, restaurants, bars and cafes.
